title: International military intervention against the Islamic State
summary: In response to rapid territorial gains made by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) during the first half of 2014, and its universally condemned executions, reported human rights abuses and the fear of further spillovers of the Syrian Civil War, many states began to intervene against it in both the Syrian Civil War and the War in Iraq.[174] Later, there were also minor interventions by some states against ISIL-affiliated groups in Nigeria and Libya.
